summary: Kuwaiti-born Mohammod Youssuf Abdulazeez, 24, a naturalized US citizen, opened fire at a Naval reserve center, and then drove to a military recruitment office where he shot and killed four Marines and a Navy service member, and wounded a police officer and another military service member. He was then fatally shot in an exchange of gunfire with law enforcement officers responding to the attack.
mentalhealthnotes: Abdulazeez "had suffered for years from depression and possibly from bipolar disorder," according to a representative of the family. (NYT, July 20 2015)
whereweaponobtained: On the internet, via Armslist.com

summary: Dylann Storm Roof, 21, shot and killed 9 people after opening fire at the Emanuel AME Church in Charleston, South Carolina. According to a roommate, he had allegedly been ¬â√õ√èplanning something like that for six months."
whereweaponobtained: Shooter's Choice gun store in West Columbia, South Carolina

summary:
Jaylen Fryberg, 15, using a .40-caliber Berretta, shot five 
students at Marysville High School, including two of his cousins and three friends, killing all but one. Fryberg arranged to meet them for lunch in the school cafeteria by text. Fryberg was reportedly well-liked at the school and there was not believed to be any ill-will between him and his victims. He committed suicide at the scene.
mentalhealthnotes: Fryberg was well-liked and allegedly happy, but was also upset about a girl and had posted emotional social media messages. No definitive signs of mental health problems.
whereweaponobtained: Gun was his father's.

summary: Cherie Lash Rhoades, 44, opened fire at the Cedarville Rancheria Tribal Office and Community Center, killing four and wounding two. After running out of ammunition, Rhoades grabbed a butcher knife and stabbed another person.
whereweaponobtained: Unknown
typeofweapons: Two handguns and a butcher knife

summary: Aaron Alexis, 34, a military veteran and contractor from Texas, opened fire in the Navy installation, killing 12 people and wounding 8 before being shot dead by police.
mentalhealthnotes: Had told Rhode Island police the prior month that he'd "heard voices"; had been undergoing mental health treatment with Veterans Affairs since August 2013.
whereweaponobtained: Sharpshooters Small Arms Range
typeofweapons: Sawed-off shotgun, 2 boxes of shells; also a .45-caliber handgun taken from a security guard he shot at the scene.

summary: Pedro Vargas, 42, set fire to his apartment, killed six people in the complex, and held another two hostages at gunpoint before a SWAT team stormed the building and fatally shot him.
mentalhealthnotes: His mother told authorities her son had been acting strangely and needed a psychiatric evaluation.
whereweaponobtained: Florida Gun Center

summary: John Zawahri, 23, armed with a homemade assault rifle and high-capacity magazines, killed his brother and father at home and then headed to Santa Monica College, where he was eventually killed by police.
mentalhealthnotes: He was known as a solitary teen who regularly ditched class and had an interest in assault weapons; he had been admitted to UCLA's psychiatric ward for a brief period.
whereweaponobtained: Assembled a rifle out of component parts.
typeofweapons: Assault rifle, high capacity magazines, antique handgun
weapondetails: .223-caliber semi-automatic assault rifle, about 40 high capacity magazines, "black powder" handgun (likely antique)

summary: Dennis Clark III, 27, shot and killed his girlfriend in their shared apartment, and then shot two witnesses in the building's parking lot and a third victim in another apartment, before being killed by police.
whereweaponobtained: Unknown
weapondetails: .40 caliber semi-automatic handgun, pistol grip shotgun

summary: Kurt Myers, 64, shot six people in neighboring towns, killing two in a barbershop and two at a car care business, before being killed by officers in a shootout after a nearly 19-hour standoff.
whereweaponobtained: Frank's Guns in Marcy, NY

summary: Adam Lanza, 20, shot his mother dead at their home then drove to Sandy Hook Elementary school. He forced his way inside and opened fire, killing 20 children and six adults before committing suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: Lanza had a history of serious mental health problems that were known to his family and others, as detailed in a post-massacre investigation by Connecticut authorities.
whereweaponobtained: Stolen from mother
typeofweapons: Two semiautomatic handguns, one rifle (assault), one shotgun (assault)
weapondetails: 10mm Glock, 9mm SIG Sauer P226 semiautomatic handguns; .223 Bushmaster XM15-E2S semiautomatic rifle; Izhmash Saiga-12 12-gauge semiautomatic shotgun

summary: Andrew Engeldinger, 36, upon learning he was being fired, went on a shooting rampage, killing the business owner, three fellow employees, and a UPS driver. He then killed himself.
mentalhealthnotes: His family worried about his "paranoia and delusions" for at least two years prior, and tried to get him to seek treatment.
whereweaponobtained: Unknown

summary: U.S. Army veteran Wade Michael Page, 40, opened fire in a Sikh gurdwara before he died from a self-inflicted gunshot would during a shootout with police.
mentalhealthnotes: His Army friends once broke into his apartment, fearing he'd commit suicide in the '90s. A psychiatric nurse who lived downstairs from Page said it was "obvious" he had a mental illness.
whereweaponobtained: Unknown

summary: James Holmes, 24, opened fire in a movie theater during the opening night of "The Dark Night Rises" and was later arrested outside.
mentalhealthnotes: He saw at least three mental health professionals before dropping out of his university.
whereweaponobtained: Gander Mountain stores in Thornton and Aurora, Colo.; Bass Pro Shop in Denver, Colo.; BulkAmmo.com
typeofweapons: Two semiautomatic handguns, one rifle (assault), one shotgun
weapondetails: Two .40-caliber Glock semiautomatic handguns; .223-caliber Smith & Wesson M&P15 semiautomatic rifle; 12-gauge Remington 870 pump-action shotgun

summary: Ian Stawicki, 40, gunned down four patrons at a cafe, and another person during a carjacking nearby, then shot himself as police closed in. (He died later that day in a Seattle hospital.)
mentalhealthnotes: His family said he was mentally ill
whereweaponobtained: Bull's Eye Shooter Supply in Tacoma, Wash.

summary: One L. Goh, 43, a former student, opened fire in a nursing classroom. He fled the scene by car and was arrested nearby a few hours later.
mentalhealthnotes: A former instructor at Oikos described him as "mentally unstable" and "paranoid."
whereweaponobtained: Bullseye in Castro Valley, Calif.

summary: Jeong Soo Paek, 59, returned to a Korean spa from which he'd been kicked out after an altercation. He gunned down two of his sisters and their husbands before committing suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: His sister worried about his homicidal tendencies; she said his mental health had been deteriorating and that he had threatened to commit suicide with his gun.
whereweaponobtained: Unknown

summary: Scott Evans Dekraai, 42, opened fire inside a hair salon and was later arrested.
mentalhealthnotes: He suffered from bipolar disorder, mood swings, and PTSD.
whereweaponobtained: Unknown
weapondetails: .45-caliber Heckler & Koch, 9mm Springfield semiautomatic handguns; .44 Magnum Smith & Wesson revolver

summary: Eduardo Sencion, 32, opened fire at an International House of Pancakes restaurant and later died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound.
mentalhealthnotes: He was diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia as a teenager and feared demons were out to get him.
whereweaponobtained: Purchased from an individual
weapondetails: AK-47 Norinco Arms variant, AK-47 Romarm Cugir variant automatic rifles; .38-caliber Colt revolver

summary: Jared Loughner, 22, opened fire outside a Safeway during a constituent meeting with Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords (D-Ariz.) before he was subdued by bystanders and arrested.
mentalhealthnotes: His symptoms pointed to various possible mental illness diagnoses, such as schizophrenia and delusional disorder. He also experimented with pot and hallucinogens.
whereweaponobtained: Sportsmen's Warehouse in Tucson, Ariz.

summary: Omar S. Thornton, 34, shot up his Hartford Beer Distributor workplace after facing disciplinary issues, then committed suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: He apparently was driven over the edge by unaddressed, ongoing racism against him at work
whereweaponobtained: Gun dealer in East Windsor, Conn.

summary: Maurice Clemmons, 37, a felon who was out on bail for child-rape charges, entered a coffee shop on a Sunday morning and shot four police officers who had gone there to use their laptops before their shifts. Clemmons, who was wounded fleeing the scene, was later shot dead by a police officer in Seattle after a two-day manhunt.
mentalhealthnotes: He had a history of erratic, bizarre behavior. He once asked his family to get naked for 5 minutes on Sunday; he said he thought the world would end and that he was Jesus.
whereweaponobtained: Stolen from an individual in Seattle.
weapondetails: 9mm Glock 17 semiautomatic handgun; .38-caliber Smith & Wesson revolver

summary: Army psychiatrist Nidal Malik Hasan, 39, opened fire on an Army base in an attack linked to Islamist extremism. Hasan was injured during the attack and later arrested.
mentalhealthnotes: Medical officials at Walter Reed Army Medical Center and the Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences raised concerns prior to the shooting regarding Hasan's aloof and erratic behavior and extremist Islamic views.
whereweaponobtained: Guns Galore in Kileen, Texas

summary: Jiverly Wong, 41, opened fire at an American Civic Association center for immigrants before committing suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: He apparently harbored growing paranoia toward cops. He also sent a delusional letter to a local TV station right before the shooting.
whereweaponobtained: Gander Mountain in Johnson City, N.Y.

summary: Robert Stewart, 45, opened fire at a nursing home where his estranged wife worked before he was shot and arrested by a police officer.
mentalhealthnotes: His estranged wife told her workplace that her husband had an "unstable mental state or (was) mentally ill."
whereweaponobtained: Local sporting goods stores and individuals

summary: Disgruntled employee Wesley Neal Higdon, 25, shot up an Atlantis Plastics factory after he was escorted out of his workplace for an argument with a supervisor. Higdon shot the supervisor outside the factory before opening fire on coworkers inside. He then committed suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: He called his girlfriend two hours before the shooting to say he was going to kill his boss.
whereweaponobtained: Unknown

summary: Steven Kazmierczak, 27, opened fire in a lecture hall, then shot and killed himself before police arrived.
mentalhealthnotes: After high school, his parents placed him at a psychiatric treatment center. He told friends he left the Army after six months due to a psychological discharge.
whereweaponobtained: Online and gun retailers in Champaign, Ill.
weapondetails: 9mm Glock 19, Hi-Point CF380, 9mm Kurz SIG Sauer P232 semiautomatic handguns; 12-gauge Remington Sportsman 48 sawed-off shotgun

summary: Charles "Cookie" Lee Thornton, 52, went on a rampage at the city hall before being shot and killed by police.
mentalhealthnotes: He was known for histrionics and disruptions at city council meetings. His mounting debt was a stressor.
whereweaponobtained: Taken in burglary and from fallen police officer
weapondetails: .40-caliber Smith & Wesson semiautomatic handgun; .44 Magnum Smith & Wesson Model 29 revolver

summary: Robert A. Hawkins, 19, opened fire inside Westroads Mall before committing suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: He had been treated in the past for depression and ADHD.
whereweaponobtained: Stolen from grandfather

summary: Off-duty sheriff's deputy Tyler Peterson, 20, opened fire inside an apartment after an argument at a homecoming party. He fled the scene and later committed suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: The families of victims filed a wrongful death lawsuit against the county arguing that the police department should have evaluated the gunman's mental health before hiring him.
whereweaponobtained: Issued by Forest County Sheriff's Department

summary: Virginia Tech student Seung-Hui Cho, 23, opened fire on his school's campus before committing suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: A district court ruled Cho was "an imminent danger" to himself and others as a result of mental illness two years earlier, and directed Cho to seek treatment.
whereweaponobtained: Purchased variously online and from Roanoke Firearms in Roanoke, Va.

summary: Sulejman Talovi¬Ä√†√•√†, 18, rampaged through the shopping center until he was shot dead by police.
mentalhealthnotes: According to one relative, he was violent and had the mental capacity of a child. (But accounts from others did not indicate this about the shooter.)
whereweaponobtained: Purchased variously from Sportsman's Fast Cash in West Valley City, Utah and individuals
weapondetails: Mossberg Maverick 88 Field shotgun; .38-caliber Smith & Wesson M36 revolver

summary: Charles Carl Roberts, 32, shot 10 young girls in a one-room schoolhouse in Bart Township, killing 5, before taking his own life.
mentalhealthnotes: He told his wife that he'd molested two young relatives 20 years ago.
whereweaponobtained: Local stores in Nickel Mines, Penn.
typeofweapons: One semiautomatic handgun, one rifle, one shotgun
weapondetails: Springfield semiautomatic handgun; .30-06 Ruger bolt-action rifle; 12-gauge Browning pump-action shotgun

summary: Kyle Aaron Huff, 28, opened fire at a rave afterparty in the Capitol Hill neighborhood of Seattle before committing suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: Police were unable to find any record that he had been treated for mental illness or was on psychiatric medication.
whereweaponobtained: Various sporting goods stores in Kalispell, Mont.

summary: Former postal worker Jennifer Sanmarco, 44, shot dead a former neighbor then drove to the mail processing plant where she used to work. Inside, she opened fire, killing six employees before committing suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: She was placed on retirement disability for psychological reasons. Fellow employees described her behavior as increasingly bizarre. She believed the Postal Service employees were conspiring against her.

summary: Jeffrey Weise, 16, murdered his grandfather, who was a police officer, and grandfather's girlfriend. Weise then drove his grandfather's squad car to Red Lake Senior High School and opened fire on the reservation campus, killing another seven people before committing suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: He voluntarily visited a a psychiatric ward. He was hospitalized at least once for suicidal tendencies and was taking Prozac.

summary: Living Church of God member Terry Michael Ratzmann, 44, opened fire at a church meeting at a Sheraton hotel before committing suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: Neighbors said he suffered from depression and had a drinking problem.

summary: Nathan Gale, 25, possibly upset about the breakup of Pantera, gunned down former Pantera guitarist Dimebag Darrell and three others at a Damageplan show before a police officer fatally shot Gale.
mentalhealthnotes: He was discharged from the military because he was a paranoid schizophrenic.

summary: Assembly line worker Douglas Williams, 48, opened fire at his Lockheed Martin workplace in a racially motivated attack before committing suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: His cousin said he was depressed and "going through a lot of things."

summary: Michael McDermott, 42, opened fire on co-workers at Edgewater Technology and was later arrested.
mentalhealthnotes: Psychiatrist guessed he had schizophrenia, but McDermott had researched how to fake a mental illness on the internet. Defense lawyer described history of suicide attempts and mental illness dating back to teen years. Jury rejected his insanity defense.

summary: Hotel employee Silvio Leyva, 36, gunned down four coworkers at the Radisson Bay Harbor Inn before killing a woman outside who refused to give him her car. He was arrested shortly after the shootings.

summary: Larry Gene Ashbrook, 47, opened fire inside the Wedgwood Baptist Church during a prayer rally before committing suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: His siblings decribed him as a paranoid schizophrenic.

summary: Day trader Mark O. Barton, 44, who had recently lost a substantial sum of money, went on a shooting spree through two day-trading firms. He started at the All-Tech Investment Group, where he worked, then went on to Momentum Securities. He fled and hours later, after being cornered by police outside a gas station, committed suicide. (Two days before the spree, he killed his wife and two children with a hammer.)
mentalhealthnotes: In letters, he details his deep depression and downward spiral.

mentalhealthnotes: Harris was an alleged psychopath; Klebold was depressed and suicidal.

summary: After he was expelled for having a gun in his locker, Kipland P. Kinkel, 15, a freshman at Thurston High, went on a shooting spree, killing his parents at home and two students at school. Five classmates wrestled Kipland to the ground before he was arrested.
mentalhealthnotes: Doctors testified that he was a paranoid schizophrenic who suffered from hallucinations
whereweaponobtained: Purchased variously from friend and father, and stolen from father

summary: Lottery worker Matthew Beck, 35, gunned down four bosses over a salary dispute before committing suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: He had been hospitalized for psychiatric reasons and had a history of depression

summary: Former Caltrans employee Arturo Reyes Torres, 41, opened fire at a maintenance yard after he was fired for allegedly selling government materials he'd stolen from work. He was shot dead by police.
mentalhealthnotes: He was disgruntled after being fired.
whereweaponobtained: B&B Gun Sales in Orange County, Calif.

summary: Ex-con Hastings Arthur Wise, 43, opened fire at the R.E. Phelon Company in retaliation for being fired after an argument with a supervisor. He attempted suicide by ingesting insecticide, failed, and was executed by the state of South Carolina eight years later.
mentalhealthnotes: An ex-con, he had been freed from prison, although he displayed violent tendencies.
whereweaponobtained: Unknown

summary: Fired city park employee Clifton McCree, 41, opened fire on former coworkers he called "racist devils" inside their municipal trailer in an act of revenge after failing a drug test. He then committed suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: Co-workers complained about his threats and verbal abuse. His supervisors asked him to get a psychiatric evaluation. He lost his job, which relatives said drove his depression.
whereweaponobtained: Unknown

summary: Disgruntled former metallurgist James Daniel Simpson, 28, opened fire throughout the Walter Rossler Company where he had worked before exiting the building and committing suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: He was likely angry because he was given an assignment at work he didn't like. But acquaintances didn't know why he'd come back and kill.
whereweaponobtained: Unknown

summary: Former airman Dean Allen Mellberg, 20, opened fire inside a hospital at the Fairchild Air Force Base before he was shot dead by a military police officer outside.
mentalhealthnotes: He was repeatedly diagnosed with emotional problems during his two years of service.
whereweaponobtained: Gun dealer in Spokane, Wash.

summary: Nathan Dunlap, 19, a recently fired Chuck E. Cheese's employee, went on a rampage through his former workplace and was arrested the following day. He now awaits execution on death row.
mentalhealthnotes: While he was in prison awaiting trial, he started acting bizarre by stripping naked and playing with his feces, apparently to avoid the death penalty. A state doctor testified that Dunlap was was faking his mental illness.
whereweaponobtained: Unknown

summary: Colin Ferguson, 35, opened fire on an eastbound Long Island Rail Road train as it approached a Garden City station. He was later arrested.
mentalhealthnotes: Psychiatrists and others said he suffered from racial paranoia and was obsessed with nonexistent conspiracies. His landlord said he had "delusions of grandeur."
whereweaponobtained: Turner's Outdoorsman in Signal Hill, Calif.

summary: Army Sgt. Kenneth Junior French, 22, opened fire inside Luigi's Italian restaurant while ranting about gays in the military before he was shot and arrested by police.
mentalhealthnotes: He had an abusive father, who committed suicide.
whereweaponobtained: Unknown

summary: Failed businessman Gian Luigi Ferri, 55, opened fire throughout an office building before he committed suicide inside as police pursued him.
mentalhealthnotes: He was down on his luck because of failed business decisions. One acquaintance said, "He was the least likely guy you can imagine doing something like that."  His ex-wife said he "hated violence."
whereweaponobtained: Super Pawn and Pacific Tactical Weapons, both in Las Vegas, Nev.

summary: John T. Miller, 50, killed four child-support workers in a county office building before turning the gun on himself.  Miller was upset about a court order garnishing his paycheck to cover overdue child-support payments.
mentalhealthnotes: The day before the shooting, he told child-support collection office workers that he was considering suicide. He had been convicted of felonious assault for pointing a revolver at police officers responding to a domestic violence report at this girlfriend's apartment.

summary: Former Lindhurst High School student Eric Houston, 20, angry about various personal failings, killed three students and a teacher at the school before surrendering to police after an eight-hour standoff. He was later sentenced to death.
mentalhealthnotes: He suffered violent physical abuse as a child. He claimed a teacher had sexually abused him, but the truth of that allegation was contested.
whereweaponobtained: Local gun retailer

summary: Laid-off postal worker Thomas McIlvane, 31, opened fire at his former workplace before committing suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: Police revoked his CCW permit after determining he was mentally unstable.

summary: Former graduate student Gang Lu, 28, went on a rampage on campus and then committed suicide at the scene.
mentalhealthnotes: He was described as darkly disturbed and isolated.
whereweaponobtained: Fin & Feather in Iowa City, Iowa

summary: George Hennard, 35, drove his pickup truck into a Luby's cafeteria and opened fire before committing suicide.
mentalhealthnotes: Acquaintances described him as troubled, unstable, combative, and misogynistic. He made convenience store employees "nervous."
whereweaponobtained: Mike's Gun Shop in Henderson, Nev.

summary: James Edward Pough, 42, opened fire at a General Motors Acceptance Corporation office before committing suicide. (The day prior, Pough killed a pimp and prostitute and injured two others. Those victims are not included in the mass murder count.)

summary: Joseph T. Wesbecker, 47, gunned down eight people at his former workplace before committing suicide.
